comment: Great Professor! Only 3 exams so be sure to study and go over lectures and notes. 5 homework assignments really easy just for completion. Do the work and you are gonna love it, amazing and chill professor. Available outside of class if you ever need help.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Statistics can be tough, but he simplifies it well. I grasped the concepts but struggled with the application, and he helped through Teams and office hours. He encourages questions and is organized, and his tests reflect homework problems. Completing homework is key to passing, and he offers extra credit. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor! Caring guy and wants you to pass. Does do homework every class but gives answers. Explains complicated concepts easily. Takes his time to work with you and makes sure that you understand everything. Comes off a little strong at the beginning of the semester though. Grades fairly!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Phelan is one of the best professor's to take for Business Stats. Definitely do the homework as most of those questions are on the exam as long response questions. The in-class lectures go over most chapters of the unit so make sure you attend classes every day. This class has difficult content but you should be fine as long as you study.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Phelan was very fun and wanted to help you if you participated. He told us the first day that if you didn't study you weren't going to pass. Three exams counted 90% of the grade. On two he let everyone do corrections to make up half the points they missed. He gave practice problems, worked examples, and had lots of office hours.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Phelan is amazing, bstats is a hard class but with him it's a lot easier to follow & he's always open to questions. His office hours are extremely helpful, he cares for his students and wants everyone to succeed and is willing to help you as long as you put in the effort. Go to lecture's, office hours and do the homework you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Caring--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I've taken B-stat w 3 other prof. Prof. Phelan is the way to go! This is a hard class but I found his teaching much easier to follow, & office hours were a huge help. If you stay on top of the HW and go to class, you'll be fine. He was a forgiving grader as well, which helped since he only graded by tests and 5 HW's. I rarely used the textbook.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor. Tough class if you do not show up for it. Test are nothing like the practice questions. Homework is worth 10% of your grade, while tests are 90%, so make sure you do not fail them.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: This is a hard class you have to practice outside of class. Professor Phelan is a excellent teacher. He talks a little fast, but he is thorough. He doesn't hold your hand, you have to put in the effort. If this course were easy everyone would have a A, but it's not. That being said Professor Phelan is the best teacher for this class. Take him.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: he's probably the best business stat teacher you can take here in ksu. while his lectures are a little fast, he makes sure you understand it and reviews a lot before a test. you MUST practice outside of class and take this course seriously as you wont do good. attend office hours, do the hw, and study!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: This is a hard class you will not pass if you don't practice outside of class. He is a funny professor, and passionate about his field. If you need help he will gladly explain the concepts that confuse you.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Phelan is definitely one of the better options to take for business stats. His lectures are pretty good and don't make you want to fall asleep. He goes over the homework each class period which is nice because sometimes they can be a bit challenging but do not get discouraged by that because the tests are easier than the homework.
rating_tags: Caring

comment: He is very passionate about not only teaching but making sure you both understand the material and will pass the class. You have to put effort into learning the material on your own time, but he was always willing to help during office hours.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof Phelan is an amazing teacher. He's super funny and makes business stats interesting by talking about how he relates class content to his actual profession. The class had three tests each worth 30% of your grade and he collected 5 homework assignments that were worth the final 10%. The class can be challenging but this guy is a good prof.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I was worried about the difficulty of this class when the semester started, but Professor Phelan helped me so much. You will need to study 20-30 minutes each day and do every homework if you want an A in the class, but Professor Phelan gives a lot of partial and extra credit and makes an effort to help you pass. I enjoyed having him.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Not an easy class, but he is a good professor. He is very blunt, and goes over plenty of examples in class. If you go to class and put in the effort, you will pass.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He was ok. Attendance isn't mandatory but helps since he goes over examples in class that aren't on slides. Try to be specific with questions as he tends to over explain sometimes. 5 hw and 3 tests are graded. Tests are given back and you can regain points by making corrections. Don't forget about hw since that cost me an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Phelan is really helpful. He goes over the homework in class and answers every question. If you go to his office hours he will do everything to help. I'm a below-average math student, but since I've been getting help from him and being engaged in class, I'm on track by now to get at least a B even if I get as low as a 65 on the final exam.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: He isnt a bad professor! He knows what hes talking about and he is very knowledgeable about what he is teaching! He is super straight up about everything. He lets you ask as many questions and doesnt make you feel dumb lol. Its a hard class and you definitely need to study his hws over a lot before tests.

He is a cool professor he keeps it 100% real with you. You are graded off 4 HWs and 3 Exams so you really gotta do good on the exams. I stopped going to class half way through the semester but I would recommend you go to class. Statistics is difficult but hes pretty cool. If you want an A you have to put the effort in to the max.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: You have to want it, but this class has a very attainable way of getting an A. He is so accessible outside of class, and going to his office hours cleared things up whenever I got confused. Make sure you keep on top of your work or you will fall behind. I had to study three hours for every hour lecture, but it wasn't that bad
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Get ready to do lots of studying. The material he teaches is difficult to understand and the way he taught made it more confusing. There are weekly homework's but in order to do well in the class you have to do well on the exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I absolutely loved Professor Phelan's class! He made a hard subject somewhat easy and it is definitely not impossible to get an A . He pretty much explains exactly what's on his tests ahead of time, as well as giving a formula sheet on tests. Homework grades are easy 100 and attendance not mandatory. Wish I could take him for more classes!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: The most intimidating part of this class was that 3 tests make up 90% of your final grade. His lectures are fast paced, so if you do not understand in lectures, go to his office hours. Tests are calculation heavy, understandably, so be sure to study. The guy isnt afraid to casually swear during a lecture, I feel like that makes him more relatable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He does go through lectures pretty quickly but he always posts them online and he has days where the whole class period is just review and you can ask questions from previous things if you didn't understand them. tests are easy and very straight forward although you do have to study for them. attendance isn't mandatory but it does help to attend.

Don't do it to yourself. Talks incredibly fast and presents straight from his ppt slides so he doesn't teach just reiterates what the slides say. He finishes his lectures in 30mins because he goes so fast and no one asks questions because no one knows what to ask. Not flexible whatsoever and is not committed to helping you succeed.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dont even bother. The work is so tough and even if you study for weeks theres no way to make a high grade on the tests.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This. Class. Teacher was really nice, but this class beat me up. I even took the initiative to get tutoring, but the tests were insane.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He talks very softly and teaches new material like its a review. I wouldnt take him unless you have experience in stats. He gives test corrections and offers extra hw assignments to help your grade. Doesnt explain material well at all. Most people in class are usually lost.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Tough but doable work
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria
